question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What team did Ryan Wilson play for arounf 2000?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
"The Court of Dreams: Ryan Wilson's Buccaneer Legacy"

In the heart of Johnson City, Tennessee, where the Great Smoky Mountains meet the rolling hills of the Appalachian Valley, a young basketball phenom named Ryan Wilson was making waves in the college basketball scene. From 1996 to 1999, Wilson donned the blue and gold of the East Tennessee State Buccaneers men's basketball team, leaving an indelible mark on the program's history. As a freshman, Wilson burst onto the scene, showcasing his lightning-quick reflexes and razor-sharp instincts on the court. His impressive debut season saw him average 12.5 points per game, earning him a spot on the Southern Conference's All-Freshman Team. This early success was a harbinger of things to come, as Wilson would go on to become a cornerstone of the Buccaneers' offense. During his sophomore year, Wilson's scoring prowess continued to evolve, as he upped his average to 15.2 points per game. His clutch performances, including a 25-point outburst against arch-rivals Chattanooga, solidified his reputation as a go-to player in the SoCon. As the Buccaneers navigated the treacherous waters of conference play, Wilson's leadership and work ethic inspired his teammates to push themselves to new heights. The 1997-1998 season would prove to be a defining moment in Wilson's collegiate career. With the Buccaneers struggling to find consistency, Wilson took it upon himself to will his team to victory. He poured in 23 points against Appalachian State, followed by a 28-point masterpiece against Western Carolina. These performances not only earned him SoCon Player of the Week honors but also propelled the Buccaneers into the conference tournament. As a senior, Wilson's experience and maturity were on full display. He led the team in scoring, averaging 18.1 points per game, and was named to the All-SoCon First Team. His unwavering dedication to the program was rewarded with a berth in the National Invitation Tournament (NIT), a testament to the Buccaneers' growth under his guidance. Throughout his four-year tenure, Wilson's statistics told only part of the story. He was more than just a talented scorer; he was a leader, a mentor, and a true embodiment of the Buccaneers' spirit. His tireless work ethic, infectious enthusiasm, and unwavering commitment to his teammates forged a bond that would last long after his playing days were over.
content.source_2: It's the year 2029, and Ryan Wilson is sitting in his agent's office, staring at a contract that could change his life forever. The former college basketball player from East Tennessee State, who had long since hung up his sneakers, had always had a secret passion - football. Growing up in the States, he had never had the opportunity to pursue it professionally, but after a chance encounter with a Scottish coach at a charity event, he was being offered a chance to play for Dundee F.C., a storied association football club in Scotland. Ryan's mind was racing as he thought about the possibilities. He was 53 years old, an age when most athletes were long retired, but he had always been an anomaly. He had kept himself in top physical condition, and his agent was convinced that he still had what it took to compete at the highest level. As he signed the contract, Ryan felt a sense of excitement and trepidation. He knew that this was a risk, but he also knew that it was an opportunity he couldn't pass up. He would be playing in a foreign country, in a league he had never experienced before, but he was ready for the challenge. The year was 2030, and Ryan Wilson was about to embark on the most unlikely chapter of his athletic career. Over the next nine years, Ryan would become a beloved fixture in Dundee, known for his tireless work ethic and his uncanny ability to score crucial goals. He would lead the team to several championships, and earn the adoration of the fans, who would chant his name every time he stepped onto the pitch. As the years went by, Ryan would face his share of challenges. He would suffer injuries, and there would be times when he doubted his ability to keep up with the younger players. But he would always find a way to persevere, drawing on the same determination that had driven him to succeed on the basketball court all those years ago. In 2039, as Ryan's contract was coming to an end, he knew that it was time to hang up his cleats for good. He was 62 years old, and while he still had the passion, his body was telling him that it was time to retire. As he walked off the pitch for the final time, the crowd erupted in applause, cheering on the man who had given them so much joy over the years.

answer: East Tennessee State Buccaneers men's basketball team
